revised_title: Regulated Expression of P-Globin Genes in Murine Erythroleukemia Cells
tldr: The authors studied the DNA sequences required for the regulated expression of p-globin genes in murine erythroleukemia (MEL) cells. They found that human p-globin gene expression is regulated during MEL cell differentiation and that the regulatory DNA sequences are located both 5' and 3' to the translation initiation site.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Molecular Biology
